entry.value: select wl.wellname, wl.location, p.* from dbo.wells wl INNER JOIN dbo.production p on wl.wellname = p.wellname

import json import java.io from org.apache.commons.io import IOUtils from java.nio.charset import StandardCharsets from org.apache.nifi.processor.io import StreamCallback
class ModJSON(StreamCallback): def __init__(self): pass def process(self, inputStream, outputStream): text = IOUtils.toString(inputStream, StandardCharsets.UTF_8) obj = json.loads(text) newObj = { "Alert": "Tank Level", "ID": obj['values']['treating-pressure'] } outputStream.write(bytearray(json.dumps(newObj, indent=4).encode('utf-8')))
flowFile = session.get() if (flowFile != None): flowFile = session.write(flowFile, ModJSON()) flowFile = session.putAttribute(flowFile, "filename", flowFile.getAttribute('filename').split('.')[0]+'_translated.json') session.transfer(flowFile, REL_SUCCESS) session.commit()

Attributes to Send as HTTP Headers (Regex)

entry.value: SELECT wellname, '${wellpressure}' AS pressure, avgpressure, stdpressure FROM productionstatistics WHERE wellname = '${wellname}'

import json import java.io from org.apache.commons.io import IOUtils from java.nio.charset import StandardCharsets from org.apache.nifi.processor.io import StreamCallback
class ModJSON(StreamCallback): def __init__(self): pass def process(self, inputStream, outputStream): text = IOUtils.toString(inputStream, StandardCharsets.UTF_8) obj = json.loads(text) avgPressure = float(obj['avgpressure']) stdDev = float(obj['stdpressure'])*2 pressureTop = avgPressure+stdDev pressureBottom = avgPressure-stdDev if float(obj['pressure'])>pressureTop or float(obj['pressure']) < pressureBottom: newObj = { "ID": 432, "skidName": obj['wellname'], "alertMessage": "Pressure Alert" } outputStream.write(bytearray(json.dumps(newObj, indent=4).encode('utf-8')))
flowFile = session.get() if (flowFile != None): flowFile = session.write(flowFile, ModJSON()) flowFile = session.putAttribute(flowFile, "filename", flowFile.getAttribute('filename').split('.')[0]+'_translated.json') session.transfer(flowFile, REL_SUCCESS) session.commit()
